div.p: I am sending the acts of the Augsburg council together.
There is still nothing certain about the affairs of France.

Can anyone write before everyone has returned to quieter places from the inauguration and anointing? The Lord uses His means beyond the grasp of human understanding and in a moment changes many matters, softens the most obstinate minds, strengthens the weak, and raises and restores desperate situations. What you wrote about the Saxon disputes was most pleasing to me.
We must expect great progress everywhere. Farewell well.
